verses.verse: Concerning the amounts of time and the appointed times, brothers, you have no need for anything to be written to you.
You see, you yourselves accurately realize that the day of the Master comes like this, as a thief in the night.

You see, when they say peace and certainty, then unexpected destruction stands over them, even as the labor pain stands over the woman having a baby in her womb. And they will not in any way escape from it.
But you, brothers, are not in darkness that the day might take you down as a thief.
You all are sons of light and sons of day. We are not of night, nor of darkness.
So clearly we should not sleep, even as the rest do, but we should stay awake and be sober.
You see, the people who sleep, sleep at night, and the people who get drunk are drunk at night.
But we who are of the day should be sober, after putting on an armored vest of trust and love; and head protection, anticipation of rescue;
because God didn't place us into punishment, but into an acquisition of rescue through our Master Jesus, the Anointed King,
the One who died on our behalf so that whether we may stay awake or whether we may be sleeping, we might live at the same time together with Him.
For this reason, encourage and build each other, one for the one, just as you also are doing.
We ask you, brothers, to know the people laboring among you, presiding over you in the Master, and cautioning you;
and to be regarding them even much more in love because of their work. Be peaceful among yourselves.
We are encouraging you, brothers. Caution the defiant. Comfort the downhearted. Have the weak in front of you. Be patient toward everyone.
Look. No one should give back bad for bad to anyone, but always pursue the good thing, both for each other and for all.
Always be happy.
Constantly pray.
In everything, be thankful. You see, this is what God wants in the Anointed King Jesus for you.
Don't extinguish the Spirit.
Don't treat preachings as if they are nothing.
Examine all things. Hold the nice thing steady.
Keep yourselves away from every visual image of evil.

May the God of the peace Himself make you sacred, completely finished people. And may your entirely whole spirit, soul, and body be kept faultlessly in the arrival of our Master Jesus, the Anointed King.
The One inviting you is trustable, who will also do it.
Brothers, pray about us.
Say hello to all the brothers with a sacred friendly gesture.
I place you under an oath to the Master for this letter to be read to all the sacred brothers.
May the generosity of our Master Jesus, the Anointed King, be with you. Amen. [This first letter was written to Thessalonians from Athens]
